text: On tap at Gnarly Barley, Orlando. Lightly phenolic coriander aroma with some other herbal accent. Ginger? Clear dark yellow under a thick white collar. Sweet and zesty and spicy, complex flavour, with slight peppery phenolics, ginger, faint citrus, and medium bitterness. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth.
Growler during RBWG. Pours a cloudy yellow with small white head that lasts. The aroma is ginger, wheat, and clove. Medium mouth nice citrus, wheat, light dough, very good.
Draft. 100th wheat ale. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of tangerine, coriander, clove, wheat and banana. Medium body.
Draft - Wheat and nice bright citrus. Cloudy yellow gold with a decent white head. Creamy wheat and bright orange citrus notes. Bright and easy drinking.

Tap. Pours cloudy dirty yellow, medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma is dusty, Belgian yeast, wheat, citrus, coriander. Flavor is light sweet, little bitterness, yeast, citrus, coriander. Light body, creamy mouthfeel. Solid.

Tap. Pours a slightly cloudy yellow gold body under a small fizzy white head. The nose is really fruity and lively with some nice restrained coriander notes, plenty of yeastiness, wheat, and a bit of pale bready malt. The flavor is super soft and smooth with just the right mix of spicing, not overdone with the coriander like many American attempts as Wit. Just really smooth with plenty of yeastiness and soft wheat. Really nice soft and creamy mouthfeel with soft gentle carbonation. This is the exact beer that Id be looking for in the Florida heat. Really well done Wit.
A lightly hazed golden Wit with a thin white. In aroma, light fruity banana with smooth cloves, OK. In mouth, a nice fruity banana malt with cloves, nice. OK. On tap at Brewery.

on tap at Redlight. Citrus and coriander on the nose with hints of pepper. Pours slightly hazy gold with a dense white head. White pepper upfront with slightly bitter citrus, sweet malts following with a peppery dry finish. Very good Ron!
Draft [rating from notes]. Hazy milk white pour. Aroma of sage, coriander, ester, clove, lemongrass, ginger. Taste is similar. Palate is dry, soft, spicy finish.

This one poured a hazy yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of lots of lemongrass and ginger, some cracked wheat too. Flavor was pretty spicey and yeasty, loys of ginger for sure, but natural seeming. Unique but a bit too spicey for my liking.
Tap at the brewpub... Murky amber.. Thin white scum head... Soft sweet banana nose... Soft sweet fruits... Juicy banana
Quite nice and refreshing. I liked it and very wheatty it was too. White features and easy smooth to drink as.
@RBWG-JAX Grand Tasting-on tap-thin white-hazy yellow.  A-clove, sweet wheat.  T-sweet wheat, some clove-spice.

Draft pour on tap at the brewpub (Winter Park, FL). Pours a nice hazy straw yellow hue, some gold, gentle orange. Darker and dulled body, mellow glow on the edges shows yellow, some gentle orange in this light. More a natural applesauce feel. Frothy whitish head atop is filmy, mellow layer laces ok. Aromas are a bit more inviting, nice bready malts meet a melange of orange and lemon rind and fruit that play well against each other. Some grains of paradise give some lemon, gentle bready malt, some soapy, brighter citrus grows as it warms. Touches of straw, gentle cool spice. Coriander doesnt really show up, those Grains of Paradise offering a mellow spice and more of a lemony vibrant tang and feel. Initial is lighter end of the fold, some nicer bright orange and lemon meet bready malt, flaked wheat. Lighter body, sessionable, some mellow bready grainy elements meet orange, grains of paradise and that lemony tang. A brighter flavor, gentle soapiness, lemongrass, and mellow earth. Middle is more wheat, gentle dough, some mellow malty sweetness but pretty crisp, fairly dry. Backend offers a touch of prickly spice, mellow soap, mellow spice and dry bitterness (kinda combines with the lemon element). Touches of dryness, faint lemon cookie, spice, and dryness. Touch of soap. Pretty interesting. Much different than I normally go for, a touch tart up front. Pretty solid and more unique offering for the style. Solid.

1 Liter growler, love trying all these C&L beers .. . insane nose, smells like Kirstenbosch (google it) .. . light wheat, fresh sparkling hay, and summer spice .. . solid mouth .. . quick refreshing finish .. . . Did Washington just flash a quarter for his ID?

Clear growler shared at RBWG Grand Tasting, trying this in the hotel lobby after party. Thanks to TheCheesedMan for bringing. Pours a low haze straw, medium white foam. Nose is sharp pickled sushi ginger, sharp lemongrass. Taste is major fresh ginger, huge lemongrass, extremely herbal. Refreshing body. I liked it, but haters of over spiced beers will be terrified because this one is ridiculous.

Growler at RBWG after the grand tasting 
Appearance: Cloudy yellow with a big white head, good lacing 
Banana, clove and wheat 
Nice and clean

2/23/13. Lobby ticking, RBWG. Growler thanks to Ron and thanks to TheCheese for hauling! Hazy golden orange pour with a nice off-white head. Rich spiced aroma, almost herbal in a way, with some sweet citrus and soft wheat malts. Doughy malt flavor with citrus and more spice - plenty of spice. Tasty, though!

Growler at RBWG.  Thanks cheesedman.   Pours a light cloudy orange with a sudsy white head.  Nose is super potent lemongrass and ginger.  Flavor is exactly the same.  Pretty refreshing, but a little heavy on the spice.
Growler at RBWG 2013 Grand Tasting. Not bad, pretty sweet, lota of wheaty, doughy malts. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish, sugary wheat. Fine.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Draft... Hazy golden ale with a small, short-lived, white head. The aroma emphasizes coriander, tangerine peel and a nice, grainy, wheat component. Light-bodied with zippy carbonation. The flavor leans bitter and a tad spicy. Finishes wheaty and refreshing. Excellent session ale.
Tap at Brewpub. Pours a hazy yellow with thick off white head. Big coriander, wheat and citrus aroma. Smooth citrus body with well blended spices . Very good.
Tap at the brewpub. Tough to imagine a wheat beer getting much better than this. Fresh lemon, coriander, perfect carbonation. Awesome.

One of the best Wits I've ever had. Unfiltered pale yellow hazy pour on tap at cask and larder.this place has blown me away with their brews! It's only 5% so it's very drinkable and goes down smooth. YUM!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at Cigar City.  Pours a hazy yellow with w big white head.  Nose is huge sweet lemon, candy, lemonheads, and lemongrass with some mild yeast.  Flavor is similar- big sweet lemon with some candy sweetness and yeast.  Light in body and drinkable as hell on a hot day.

Draft at Cask & Larder. Hazy yellow pour with a frothy white head. Holy fucking aroma! Nose is loaded with lemon and lime zest, coriander, and light grains. Flavor is a little milder with fresh citrus juice, wheat grains, and floral hops. Medium bodied and crisp finish. Damn tasty beer.

On draft at Cigar City, pours a light cloudy pale yellow, aromas of loght orange zest, light earthy easters, light orange juice, and some corriander.  Flavors are the same, nice what flavor, light on the palate, and refreshing.
